LanguageData.VCR.AAtooltip:
Armor effectiveness is doubled and armor penetration of weapons is quadrupled by default

This means that 100% armor will block any attacks with no armor penetration, the equivalent of wearing 200% armor protection in vanilla.
Armor penetration of weapons has been effectively doubled relative to the displayed armor values

Example:
50% armor penetration bullet against 200% sharp protection armor
Vanilla: armor is reduced to 150%, damage is halved 25% of the time, blocked 75% of the time.
Advanced Armor: armor is reduced to 100%, damage is blocked 100% of the time.
LanguageData.VCR.ArmScaleTooltip:
Minimum threshold ap before all damage is blocked

This threshold is based on 200 divided by the value on the slider or textbox.

Recommended : 100% threshold at an entered value of 2
LanguageData.VCR.PenScaleTooltip:
Multiplier for all penetration values

Use to maintain a competitive weapon environment in conjunction with armor penetration threshold.

Recommended penetration: 2
LanguageData.VCR.AAcctooltip: Shooter Skill now affects weapon and weather accuracy, a good shooter should be able to overcome any problems with a gun or weather condition. Turret, smoke, and cover accuracy are not affected.
LanguageData.VCR.AccScaleTooltip:
Minimum accuracy before advanced accuracy calculations are activated, inversely related to accuracy per point

With a higher threshold, each point above the threshold has a smaller effect than with a lower threshold

Recommended accuracy: 5
LanguageData.VCR.BWorkerTooltip: Bullets now have simulated fragmentation, pass through, and mushrooming damage behaviors based on the stopping power of the weapon, multiple projectiles on the same weapon will use the stopping power value of the first projectile.
LanguageData.VCR.AWorkerTooltip: Arrows now are more likely to hit internal body parts or deal extra cuts if an outside body part is hit.
LanguageData.VCR.XmlSettings: Xml Settings: Need a restart to take effect
LanguageData.VCR.HandFeetTooltip: Armor and apparel cover the hands and feet of a pawn, gloves or boots are moved to the headgear layer and can be equipped along with normal armor.
LanguageData.VCR.GlassesHelmetTooltip: Changes eye protection to only cover the eyes instead of including the skull or brain.\n\nAllows for wear of a helmet covering the upper head and separate glasses/goggles in the same layer.
